roleset.name: play a game
roleset.note: PLAY-V NOTES: Member of Vncls performance-26.7-1-1. (from play.01-v)

PLAY-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb frame play.01, member of Vncls performance-26.7-1-1, meet-36.3-1. Framed by Claire. Differs from verb frame play.01 with addition of arg3, opponent (from play.01-n)
PLAYING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on play-n.01. Corresponds to Vncls meet-36.3-1. (from playing.01-n)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: John plays superbly.

example.name: transitive with game
example.text: The backers play a fiscal game of their own.
example.arg: a fiscal game of their own

example.name: specific game
example.text: The Japanese are playing catch-up.

example.name: with secondary predication
example.text: John played his outfielders deep.

example.name: Manner only
example.text: The key question is is this a tragic accident or is this foul play?

example.name: Fragment
example.text: Fair play of the United States for stepping in.

example.name: With purpose
example.text: He 's still refusing to concede defeat in last week 's election , so tens of thousands of striking workers are trying to drive him from power play .

example.name: With game
example.text: It is not uncommon for fans of chess to buy tables specifically designed for the play of chess.

example.name: With player and opponent
example.text: When asked to explain his play against a top-10 team, Walker said, ?I just took whatever the defense gave me.?

example.name: args 0, 1, 3
example.text: He chatted to our Aleksandr in the famous Meerkat IT Department about his playing scrabble with Celine Dion and breaking into Hollywood.

example.name: Hollywood passivized
example.text: [Abbie Hoffman]-1, in this case, is played *trace*-1 by Paul Lieber.

role.descr: thing factoring in, subject in active clauses

example.name: global warming
example.text: Sunspot variability possibly plays into climate variability.

roleset.name: play a trick on someone
roleset.note: PLAY-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in ON-miss. Framed by Claire. (from play.10-v)

role.descr: tricked, who trick was played on

example.name: All args
example.text: PRO playing clever little tricks on minor issues, but blinded to major issues by trifles arenot considered to be elites.

example.name: all args
example.text: John plays Mozart concerti on the harmonica.

example.name: args 0, 2
example.text: John plays the harmonica

example.name: non-musician arg0
example.text: Javier played the Led Zeppelin record on his grandmother's turntable.

roleset.name: musical/theatrical performance
roleset.note: PLAY-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, play-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls performance-26.7-1-1. (from play.02-n)
PLAYING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, play-n.02. Corresponds to VNcls performance-26.7-1-1 (from playing.02-n)

example.name: just arg1
example.text: The service began with the playing of the national anthem .
They bring audiences to their feet with virtual self playing of traditional fiddle tunes , jigs and reels
example.arg: of traditional fiddle tunes, jigs and reels

example.text: And Eagan is the only American ever to have won four all Ireland championships , for banjo , tin whistle , flute and mandolin playing .
example.arg: banjo , tin whistle , flute and mandolin

example.name: with arg2
example.text: How is it possible he woke with all his Piano playing muscles fully developed ?

example.name: bouzouki.
example.text: The film features Daffy Duck in the role of legendary outlaw Robin Hood, and opens to the strains of his playing a song on an instrument similar to an archlute or bouzouki.
example.arg: on an instrument similar to an archlute or bouzouki

role.descr: agent, entity causing something to complete

example.name: battle
example.text: The battle played out by Tuesday evening.

example.name: with agent
example.text: The consumer played himself out.

roleset.name: play up: emphasize, make sound better

example.name: spin control
example.text: Boeing played up the downside.

roleset.name: play down: deemphasize, make sound less important

example.name: pay no attention to the man behind the curtain
example.text: [The Justice Department]-1 scrambled [*-1]to play down the significance of revised guidelines concerning prosecutions under the federal racketeering law.
example.arg: the significance of revised guidelines concerning prosecutions under the federal racketeering law.

example.name: Machiavellian
example.text: John played Fred off Mary.

example.name: reflexive Machiavellian
example.text: John played the two experts off each other.

roleset.name: play to: butter up to, try to please

example.name: brown nosing
example.text: Mr. Ortega's remarks also played to the suspicions of some US officials.
example.arg: the suspicions of some US officials.

example.name: Single victim
example.text: Hamas plays on the Palestinean Authority's failure to produce.
example.arg: the Palestinean Authority's failure to produce.
